bio: Aspiring engineer interested in robotics and computer science. Active in Science Olympiad and FIRST Robotics team.
notes: Prefers morning sessions (before 10am). Working towards SAT Math 700+. Contact mom for schedule changes: jennifer.w@email.com. Test accommodations: extra time (504 plan on file).

bio: Loves reading and creative writing. Member of the school newspaper and debate team. Dreams of becoming a journalist.
notes: Working on reading comprehension for standardized tests. Dyslexia accommodations needed - extra time on assignments. Father speaks Spanish if needed. Blog: https://jameswritesstories.com

bio: National Honor Society member and Student Body VP. Interested in pursuing pre-med at top universities. Volunteers at local hospital.
notes: Advanced student working on AP Chemistry and AP Calculus BC. Very self-motivated. College apps due Dec 1 - Berkeley and MIT are top choices. Needs rec letters by Nov 10.

bio: Star basketball player on varsity team. Needs academic support to maintain eligibility for sports. Interested in sports management career.
notes: Focus on time management and study skills. Basketball practice 3-5pm weekdays. Sessions work best right after school (2:30-3pm). Use sports stats to engage with math concepts.

bio: Senior applying to Ivy League schools. Perfect GPA, national merit scholar. Plays violin in youth symphony and competes in math competitions.
notes: Extremely high achiever. Currently working on college essays and interview prep. Early decision deadline for Yale is Nov 1. Parents are very involved - weekly progress emails required.

bio: Bilingual student (English/Spanish). Struggles with reading comprehension but excels in math. Loves video games and wants to be a game designer.
notes: ESL background - started learning English in 3rd grade. Math is his strong suit. Use gaming contexts to teach concepts. Mom prefers communication in Spanish: maria.garcia@email.com

bio: Talented artist and musician. Takes AP Art History and plays piano competitively. Applying to arts conservatories for college.
notes: Creative learner - visual aids work best. Struggles with STEM subjects but excels in humanities. Piano recital Nov 15. Schedule around competition prep Oct-Dec.
